snippet: The move is intended to prevent European radicals from traveling to the United States to carry out an attack similar to the one in Paris.
abstract: Obama administration announces tightening of visa-waiver program, intended to ease flow of European tourists and other visitors from friendly countries, in bid to block anyone who has visited a conflict zone to easily enter United States on commercial flight; move comes in response to attacks in Paris, in which extremists were citizens of Europe who could have been able to fly to US without getting visa or going through any significant security screening.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from Paris, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. David M. Herszenhorn and Eric Lichtblau contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The move is intended to prevent European radicals from traveling to the United States to carry out an attack similar to the one in Paris.

headline.main: U.S. Tightens Visa-Waiver Program in Bid to Deter Militants
headline.print_headline: White House Tightens Visa-Waiver Program in a Bid to Block Militants
